702310f-a.text:
South 3rd Street, north side, east from No. 139, just east of Bedford Ave. At the left foreground is the Industrial School; beyond which is seen the South 3rd Street Presbyterian Church. Beyond the white building
is Public School No. 50.
September 10, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

702309f-a.text:
South 3rd Street, at the N.E. corner of Bedford Ave. These buildings
were still standing in (1929).
1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

703143f-b.text:
Bedford Avenue, east side, at South 3rd Street, viewing south across the latter. At the two corners of South 3rd Street are two old frame dwellings, typical of the type of houses that used to prevail in this area. The frame house at the N. E. corner (left) is number 333; the one a the S. E. corner, number 335. Photograph 2 shows an exclusive view of number 333, at the N. E. corner of the two thoroughfares.

1923
Views 1,2

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

703144f-a.text:
343 Bedford Ave., east side, between South 3rd and 4th Streets, showing the Amos Smith house, formerly known as 100-4th Street.  In 1917 a 6 story apartment house occupied the site.

About 1885.?

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
